Html:
I use Visual Studio 2010 on Windows 7 (with SDK installed) and when I build your project, I get all kinds of warnings (no errors). Mostly saying
"Warning 1 Undefined property: 'ApplicationMenu'. Using default value. D:\My Documents\My Projects\C#\Ribbon\Samples\01-AddingRibbonSupport\RibbonMarkup.xml 8 01-AddingRibbonSupport"
"Warning 2 Undefined property: 'Tab'. Using default value. D:\My Documents\My Projects\C#\Ribbon\Samples\01-AddingRibbonSupport\RibbonMarkup.xml 8 01-AddingRibbonSupport"
"Warning 4 /MACHINE not specified; defaulting to X86 D:\My Documents\My Projects\C#\Ribbon\Samples\01-AddingRibbonSupport\LINK 01-AddingRibbonSupport"

When I change the startup project to a sample, it crashes with the error: Error HRESULT E_FAIL has been returned from a call to a COM component.

When I look at the WinForms, they're all empty. They only have two panels: Ribbon Place Holder and Panel2. Some of them have buttons on Panel2.

What can I do to make your project work?

Bump?

Is my question unclear? Do I need to rephrase some sentences? Why am I not getting a reply?

Those warnings are normal, the UICC (ribbon xml compiler) warns if you don't declare some common ribbon constructs like application menu and a tab.
The linker warning can be probably avoided by providing the machine type in the projects prebuild steps, but it should work nonetheless,

I tried the same scenario on my laptop with Windows 7 + VS2010 (RC) and it worked.
You should concentrate on understanding why you get the error HRESULT.
Since you have the code, just find the point (in the ribbon project) that returns the error code. This is probably in the InitFramework method, since this is the entry point for the ribbon related code.

Also, make sure you have installed Windows SDK (with the correct bit version, 32 or 64).

Re: Also, make sure you have installed Windows SDK (with the correct bit version, 32 or 64).

Arik, what are the dependencies on the SDK (besides being the ship vehicle for UICC)?  ...for example, are there any redistributable components (assemblies, etc) that need to be included in a setup program that installs a Ribbon framework based application?

Michael Herman (Toronto)
You were right, the problem is in the InitFramework. On the "Framework.LoadUI" line. For some reason it can't load the UI. I can't seem to figure out why though. /blush

Make sure the compilation process had no errors.
If you are not sure, you can copy the compile output  to here and i'll have a look.

Also check what is the error HRESULT, might help us understand what is the problem.

I took two screenshots of my visual studio. The first screen is the build of the project. It has no errors, only 69 remarks.

VS Build

I am able to run the project, it just generates an error "Error HRESULT E_FAIL has been returned from a call to a COM component." That's what I got so far. Sorry it's not much and thanks for helping.

VS Error

I'm not sure all the warnings I see in the image are legit, specifically I don;t remember seeing "Undefined command on element".
was this ribbon xml changed or is it the original?
